event.event-label: OpenNMS defined internal event: Notifd MATCH-ANY-UEI
event.descr: This UEI should never be generated, but exists so that notifications can match any UEI for a particular filter rule. Useful to see all events for a particular node via notifications, etc.
event.logmsg: A MATCH-ANY-UEI event for generic notifications.

event.descr: The Capsd services scanning engine has asked Discovery to pause due to a backlog of interfaces yet to be scanned.
event.logmsg: Capsd has asked Discovery to pause momentarily.

event.descr: Capsd is asking Discovery to resume adding nodes to the Capsd queue.
event.logmsg: Capsd is ready for Discovery to resume scheduling nodes.

event.descr: During a rescan, the IP interfaces as determined by SNMP conflict with the IP interfaces listed in the database for this node.
event.logmsg: IP interfaces as determined by SNMP disagree with the database.

event.descr: The administrator has forced a services scan on this node to update the list of supported services.
event.logmsg: A services scan has been forced on this node: %nodelabel%

event.descr:
A services scan has been completed.

The list of services on this node has been updated.
event.logmsg: A services scan has been completed on this node: %nodelabel%

event.descr: A services scan has verified that this interface supports the SNMP protocol.
event.logmsg: A services scan has verified that this interface supports the SNMP protocol.

event.descr: A services scan has discovered the same IP address on more than one device: %interface%. The address has been added to the database under all nodes that have it. If this address is in error, please take steps to correct it.
event.logmsg: A services scan has discovered a duplicate IP address: %interface%.

event.descr: This event is an external command to add an interface/server mapping to the database. The required parameter is the IP address of the interface: %interface%, the NMS host server name: %host%, and the optional parameter of a node label: %nodelabel%. This event will cause an addInterface event.
event.logmsg: A request has been made to add an interface/server mapping to the serverMap table.

event.descr: This event is an external command to add or remove an interface/service mapping into the database. The required parameter is the IP address of the interface: %interface%, the service name: %service%, and the optional parameter action: %action%. This event will cause a changeService event with the specified action.
event.logmsg: A request has been made to add or remove an interface/service mapping to the serviceMap table.

event.descr: This event is an external command to add a node to the database. The required parameter is the IP address for the main interface: %interface%, and the optional parameter of a node label: %nodelabel%.
event.logmsg: A request has been made to add a node with interface: %interface% and node label: %nodelabel%.

event.descr: This event is an external command to delete a node from the database. The required parameter is the IP address for one interface: %interface%.
event.logmsg: A request has been made to delete a node with interface: %interface%.

event.descr: This event is an external command to add an interface to the database. The required parameter is the IP address for the main interface: %interface%.
event.logmsg: A request has been made to add an interface %interface%.

event.descr: This event is an external command to delete an interface from the database. The required parameter is the IP address for the interface: %interface%, or the nodeid %nodeid% and ifIndex %ifindex%.
event.logmsg: A request has been made to delete an interface: %interface% on node %nodeid% with ifIndex %ifindex%.

event.descr: This event will add or remove a service from an interface. The paramters include the interface, %interface%, the service, %service%, and any required qualifiers, %parm[#2]%. The action taken will be: %parm[#1]%.
event.logmsg: A request has been made to %parm[#1]% the %service% service on interface: %interface%.

event.descr: This event will cause the Provisioner to run the synchronization process. The parameter will include the URL of the provisioning group: %parm[all]%
event.logmsg: A request had been made to synchronize a provisioning group.

event.event-label: OpenNMS-defined internal event: Provisiond import process has started
event.descr: This event indicates the provisioning process has started for Provisioning Group %parm[importResource]%.
event.logmsg: This event indicates the provisioning process has started for a resource.

event.event-label: OpenNMS-defined internal event: Provisiond import process successfully completed
event.descr:
This event indicates the provisioning process has completed successfully for the Provisioning Group defined by the file %parm[importResource]%.

.

Statistics: %parm[importStats]%
event.logmsg: This event indicates the provisining process has completed successfully for a resource.

event.event-label: OpenNMS-defined internal event: Provisiond import process failed.
event.descr:
This event indicates the provisioning process has failed with the following paramters:

%parm[all]%.
event.logmsg: This event indicates the provisioning process has failed for a resource.

event.descr: This event is an external command to restart polling all active services on a specified interface. The requeried parameter is the IP address of the interface: %parm[ipaddr]%
event.logmsg: Reschedule polling to services on a specified interface: %parm[ipaddr]%

event.descr: This event will be produced by capsd to carry the process status information, so that the xmlrpcd could catch it, and reports to the external XMLRPC server. The paramters include transaction number, %parm[txNo]%, source event uei, %parm[srcUei]%, message, %parm[message]%, and process status, %parm[status]%.
event.logmsg: A request has been made to xmlrpcd to report status for %parm[srcUei]%.

event.descr: The Interface %interface% has been discovered and is being queued for a services scan.
event.logmsg: A new interface (%interface%) has been discovered and is being queued for a services scan.

event.event-label: OpenNMS-defined internal event: Capsd suspect scan completed
event.descr: The new suspect services scan of interface %interface% has completed.
event.logmsg: The new suspect services scan of interface %interface% has completed.

event.descr:
The interface %interface% is being remanaged.

This interface will now participate in service polling.
event.logmsg: The interface %interface% is now being remanaged.

event.descr:
The interface %interface% is being forcibly unmanaged.

This interface and all associated services will not be polled until the interface is remanaged.
event.logmsg: The interface %interface% is being forcibly unmanaged.

event.descr: A destination path in a notification has not been assigned any users.
event.logmsg: A destination path in a notification has not been assigned any users.

event.descr:
Notifications have been disabled.

The administrator has disabled notifications on OpenNMS. No pages or emails will be sent until notifications are reenabled.

Responsible user: %parm[remoteUser]% at %parm[remoteHost]% (%parm[remoteAddr]%)
event.logmsg: Notifications have been disabled.

event.descr:
Notifications have been enabled.

The administrator has enabled notifications on OpenNMS. Pages and/or emails will be sent based upon receipt of important events.

Responsible user: %parm[remoteUser]% at %parm[remoteHost]% (%parm[remoteAddr]%)
event.logmsg: Notifications have been enabled.

event.event-label: OpenNMS-defined internal event: Reload specified daemon configuration
event.descr: The administrator has changed the daemon: %parm[daemonName]% configuration files and requests the configuration to be re-marshaled and applied.
event.logmsg: The daemon: %parm[daemonName]% configuration files has changed.

event.event-label: OpenNMS-defined internal event: Reload specified daemon configuration failed
event.descr: The administrator has changed the daemon: %parm[daemonName]% configuration files and the request for the configuration to be re-marshaled and applied has failed. Reason: %parm[reason]%.
event.logmsg: The daemon: %parm[daemonName]% configuration changes have failed to be applied.

event.event-label: OpenNMS-defined internal event: Reload specified daemon configuration successful
event.descr: The administrator has changed the daemon: %parm[daemonName]% configuration files and the request for the configuration to be re-marshaled and applied has succeeded.
event.logmsg: The daemon: %parm[daemonName]% configuration changes have successfully been applied.

event.descr: The administrator has changed the poller configuration files. The pollers and related services will now restart to detect the changes.
event.logmsg: The poller configuration files have changed.

event.descr: The administrator has changed the ScriptD configuration. ScriptD will load the new configuration.
event.logmsg: The ScriptD configuration files have changed.

event.descr: The administrator has changed the Vacuumd configuration. Vacuumd will load the new configuration.
event.logmsg: The Vacuumd configuration files have changed.

event.descr: The administrator has changed the SnmpPoller configuration. SnmpPoller will load the new configuration.
event.logmsg: The SnmpPoller configuration files have changed.

event.descr: SNMP definition for IP address %parm[firstIPAddress]%-%parm[lastIPAddress]% has been updated with community string "%parm[communityString]%"
event.logmsg: A new SNMP community string has been defined for %parm[firstIPAddress]%-%parm[lastIPAddress]%.

event.descr: SCM has been asked to restart.
event.logmsg: SCM has been asked to restart.

event.descr: This event is generated to RTC by any process that wishes to receive POSTs of RTC data. A subscription to RTC for the %parm[viewname]% for %parm[url]% has been generated.
event.logmsg: A subscription to the RTC has been received.

event.descr: This event is generated to RTC by any subscribed process that wishes to discontinue receipt of POSTs of RTC data. Unsubscribe request received from %parm[url]%.
event.logmsg: A unsubscribe request for RTC has been received.

event.descr: The service %service% on interface %interface% is being remanaged.
event.logmsg: The service %service% on interface %interface% is being remanaged.

event.descr: The service %service% on interface %interface% is being forcibly unmanaged.
event.logmsg: The service %service% on interface %interface% is being forcibly unmanaged.

event.descr: The Scheduler has received an unrecognized service status from a scheduler.
event.logmsg: The Scheduler has received an unrecognized service status from a scheduler.

event.descr: %service% data collection on interface %interface% failed with '%parm[reason]%'.
event.logmsg: %service% data collection on interface %interface% failed.

event.descr: %service% data collection on interface %interface% previously failed and has been restored.
event.logmsg: %service% data collection on interface %interface% previously failed and has been restored.

event.descr:
Due to excessive downtime, the %service% service on interface %interface% has been scheduled for deletion.

When a service has been down for a period of time, it can be determined to have been removed and will be deleted. If the service is later rediscovered, it will be re-added and associated with the appropriate interface.

If this is the only service associated with an interface, the interface will be scheduled for deletion as well, with the generation of the deleteInterface event.
event.logmsg: The %service% service on interface %interface% has been scheduled for deletion.

event.descr: Node # %nodeid% was determined to be a duplicate node and is being flagged for deletion.
event.logmsg: %nodeid% was determined to be a duplicate node and is being flagged for deletion.

event.descr:
Interface %interface% deleted from node # %nodeid% with ifIndex %ifindex%.

This event is generated following an extended outage for a service, in which that service is the only service associated with an interface. If the service is later rediscovered, a new interface will be added and the service will be associated with that new interface.
event.logmsg: Interface %interface% has been deleted from node %nodeid%.

event.descr:
All services are down on interface %interface%

This event is generated when node outage processing determines that the critical service or all services on the interface are now down

New outage records have been created and service level availability calculations will be impacted until this outage is resolved.
event.logmsg: Interface %interface% is down.

event.event-label: OpenNMS-defined internal event: SNMP Poller SNMP interface Oper Status Down
event.descr:
The SNMP Poller has determined that the operational status of an interface is now "down".

Interface: ifname:%parm[snmpifname]% ifindex:%parm[snmpifindex]% ifdescr:%parm[snmpifdescr]%
event.logmsg: Operational status Down on interface ifname:%parm[snmpifname]% ifindex:%parm[snmpifindex]%.

event.event-label: OpenNMS-defined internal event: SNMP Poller SNMP interface Admin Status Down
event.descr:
The SNMP Poller has determined that the administrative status of an interface is now "down".

Interface: ifname:%parm[snmpifname]% ifindex:%parm[snmpifindex]% ifdescr:%parm[snmpifdescr]%
event.logmsg: Administration status Down on interface ifname:%parm[snmpifname]% ifindex:%parm[snmpifindex]%.

event.event-label: OpenNMS-defined internal event: SNMP Poller SNMP interface Oper Status Up
event.descr:
The SNMP Poller has determined that the operational status of an interface is now "up".

Interface: ifname:%parm[snmpifname]% ifindex:%parm[snmpifindex]% ifdescr:%parm[snmpifdescr]%
event.logmsg: Operational status Up on interface ifname:%parm[snmpifname]% ifindex:%parm[snmpifindex]%

event.event-label: OpenNMS-defined internal event: SNMP Poller SNMP interface Admin Status Up
event.descr:
The SNMP Poller has determined that the administration status of an interface is now "up".

Interface: ifname:%parm[snmpifname]% ifindex:%parm[snmpifindex]% ifdescr:%parm[snmpifdescr]%
event.logmsg: Administration status Up on interface ifname:%parm[snmpifname]% ifindex:%parm[snmpifindex]%

event.descr: The hostname for this node changed.
event.logmsg: The hostname for this node has changed.

event.descr:
SNMP Interface Index %parm[oldIfIndex]% has changed to %parm[newIfIndex]% on %interface%

The ifIndex, or unique numeric identifier of an SNMP device's interfaces, can be reordered by the SNMP agent. Usually this happens if interfaces are added or removed, or by a change in administrative or operational status.

This is typically not a reason for concern, but you should be aware that the active configuration on this SNMP device has changed, and the hardware configuration may have been impacted as well.
event.logmsg: SNMP Interface Index has changed on %interface%.

event.descr:
Interface %interface% has been reparented under node %parm[newNodeID]% from node %parm[oldNodeID]%.

Usually this happens after a services scan discovers that a node with multiple interfaces is now running an SNMP agent and is therefore able to reparent the node's interfaces under a single node identifier.

This is typically not a reason for concern, but you should be aware that the node association of this interface has changed.
event.logmsg: %interface% has been reparented under node %parm[newNodeID]%

event.descr:
The interface %interface% which was previously down is now up.

This event is generated when node outage processing determines that the critical service or all services on the interface are restored.

This event will cause any active outages associated with this interface to be cleared.
event.logmsg: Interface %interface% is up.

event.descr: A new node (%parm[nodelabel]%) was discovered by OpenNMS.
event.logmsg: A new node (%parm[nodelabel]%) was discovered by OpenNMS.

event.descr: A currently provisioned node (%parm[nodelabel]%) was updated by OpenNMS.
event.logmsg: A provisioned node (%parm[nodelabel]%) was updated by OpenNMS.

event.descr: Node category membership has changed for node (%parm[nodelabel]%)
event.logmsg: Node category membership has changed for node (%parm[nodelabel]%).

event.descr:
Node %nodeid% was deleted.

OpenNMS may delete any node that is down for more than a configured period of time, or via operator action. Nodes are considered "down" if there are no interfaces that have active services associated with them.

If a node becomes active again after it has been deleted, it will be rediscovered in the next discovery cycle and will be re-added to OpenNMS's database as a new node. It will be disassociated with any historic outage information.
event.logmsg: Node %parm[nodelabel]% (%nodeid%) was deleted.

event.descr:
All interfaces on node %parm[nodelabel]% are down.

This event is generated when node outage processing determines that all interfaces on the node are down.

New outage records have been created and service level availability calculations will be impacted until this outage is resolved.
event.logmsg: Node %parm[nodelabel]% is down.

event.descr:
The state of node %parm[nodelabel]% is unknown because the critical path to the node is down.

This event is generated when node outage processing determines that the critical path IP address (%parm[criticalPathIp]%) and service (%parm[criticalPathServiceName]%) for this node is not responding.
event.logmsg: Path outage for %parm[nodelabel]%.

event.descr: Interface %interface% has been associated with %nodelabel%.
event.logmsg: Interface %interface% has been associated with Node %nodelabel%.

event.descr:
A service scan has identified the %service% service on interface %interface%.

If this interface (%interface%) is within the list of ranges and specific addresses to be managed by OpenNMS, this service will be scheduled for regular availability checks.
event.logmsg: The %service% service has been discovered on interface %interface%.

event.event-label: OpenNMS-defined internal event: Linkd Data Link Failed
event.descr:
A data link between two interfaces has failed.

Data Link Failed between %parm[endPoint1]% and %parm[endPoint2]%
event.logmsg: Data Link Failed between %parm[endPoint1]% and %parm[endPoint2]%

event.event-label: OpenNMS-defined internal event: Linkd Data Link Restored
event.descr:
A data link between two interfaces has been restored.

Data Link Restored between %parm[endPoint1]% and %parm[endPoint2]%
event.logmsg: Data Link Restored between %parm[endPoint1]% and %parm[endPoint2]%

event.event-label: OpenNMS-defined internal event: Linkd Data Link Unmanaged
event.descr:
A data link between two interfaces has been unmanaged.

A link is considered unmanaged when either endpoint of a link does not have the link endpoint service as per the EndPoint configuration.

Data Link Unmanaged between %parm[endPoint1]% and %parm[endPoint2]%
event.logmsg: Data Link Unmanaged between %parm[endPoint1]% and %parm[endPoint2]%

event.descr:
A forced rescan has identified the %service% service on interface %interface% as no longer part of any poller package, or the service has been unmanaged.

Polling will be discontinued.
event.logmsg: Polling will be discontinued for %service% service on interface %interface%.

event.descr:
A forced rescan has identified the %service% service on interface %interface% as being covered by a poller package, and managed.

Polling will begin in accordance with the package and any applicable outage calendar.
event.logmsg: Polling will begin/resume for %service% service on interface %interface%.

event.descr: Node information has changed for node %nodelabel% (node ID:%nodeid%).
event.logmsg: Node information has changed for %nodelabel%.

event.descr: Node ID (%nodeid%) label was changed from "%parm[oldNodeLabel]%" to "%parm[newNodeLabel]%".
event.logmsg: The label for node ID (%nodeid%) was changed to %parm[newNodeLabel]%.

event.descr:
A %service% outage was identified on interface %interface%.

A new Outage record has been created and service level availability calculations will be impacted until this outage is resolved.
event.logmsg: %service% outage identified on interface %interface% with reason code: %parm[eventReason]%.

event.descr:
The %service% service on interface %interface% was previously down and has been restored.

This event is generated when a service which had previously failed polling attempts is again responding to polls by OpenNMS.

This event will cause any active outages associated with this service/interface combination to be cleared.
event.logmsg: The %service% outage on interface %interface% has been cleared.

event.descr:
Node %parm[nodelabel]% which was previously down is now up.

This event is generated when node outage processing determines that all interfaces on the node are up.

This event will cause any active outages associated with this node to be cleared.
event.logmsg: Node %parm[nodelabel]% is up.

event.descr:
This event indicates that the interface selected for SNMP data collection for this node has changed. This is usually due to a network or address reconfiguration impacting this device.

The primary interface has changed from %parm[oldPrimarySnmpAddress]% to %parm[newPrimarySnmpAddress]%.
event.logmsg: Primary SNMP interface for %nodelabel% has changed.

event.descr: A change in configuration on this node has been detected and the SNMP data collection mechanism is being triggered to refresh its required profile of the remote node.
event.logmsg: SNMP information on %interface% is being refreshed for data collection purposes.

event.descr: The %service% service which was previously unresponsive is now responding normally on interface %interface%.
event.logmsg: %service% is responding normally on interface %interface%.

event.descr:
Service %service% was deleted from interface %interface%, associated with Node ID# %nodeid%.

When a service is deleted from an interface, it is due to extended downtime of that service of over seven (7) days.

If a previously deleted service becomes active again on an interface, it will be re-added to the OpenNMS database as a new occurrence of that service and will be disassociated with any historic outages.
event.logmsg: The %service% service was deleted from interface %interface%.

event.descr: The %service% service is up but was unresponsive during the last poll on interface %interface%.
event.logmsg: %service% is up but unresponsive on interface %interface%.

event.descr:
A high threshold has been exceeded on %nodelabel%. The %service% data source expression %parm[ds]% on resource %parm[label]% has reached a value of %parm[value]% while the threshold is %parm[threshold]%, for %parm[trigger]% consecutive sample(s).


Description%parm[description]%
Data Source%parm[ds]%
Resource Label%parm[label]%
Resource Instance ID%parm[instance]%
Resource Instance Label%parm[instanceLabel]%
Resource ID%parm[resourceId]%
Current Metric Value%parm[value]%
Threshold Value%parm[threshold]%
Rearm Value%parm[rearm]%
Trigger Value%parm[trigger]%
event.logmsg: A high threshold has been exceeded on %nodelabel%. The %service% data source expression %parm[ds]% on resource %parm[label]% has reached a value of %parm[value]% while the threshold is %parm[threshold]%, for %parm[trigger]% consecutive sample(s).
event.operinstruct:
By default, OpenNMS watches some key parameters on devices in your network and will alert you with an event if certain conditions arise. For example, if the CPU utilization on your Cisco router maintains an inordinately high percentage of utilization for an extended period, an event will be generated. These thresholds are determined and configured based on vendor recommendations, tempered with real-world experience in working deployments.

This specific event indicates that a high threshold was exceeded.

event.descr:
A high threshold has been rearmed on %nodelabel%. The %service% data source expression %parm[ds]% on resource %parm[label]% has reached a value of %parm[value]% while the rearm value is %parm[rearm]%.


Description%parm[description]%
Data Source%parm[ds]%
Resource Label%parm[label]%
Resource Instance ID%parm[instance]%
Resource Instance Label%parm[instanceLabel]%
Resource ID%parm[resourceId]%
Current Metric Value%parm[value]%
Threshold Value%parm[threshold]%
Rearm Value%parm[rearm]%
Trigger Value%parm[trigger]%
event.logmsg: A high threshold has been rearmed on %nodelabel%. The %service% data source expression %parm[ds]% on resource %parm[label]% has reached a value of %parm[value]% while the rearm value is %parm[rearm]%.
event.operinstruct:
By default, OpenNMS watches some key parameters on devices in your network and will alert you with an event if certain conditions arise. For example, if the CPU utilization on your Cisco router maintains an inordinately high percentage of utilization for an extended period, an event will be generated. These thresholds are determined and configured based on vendor recommendations, tempered with real-world experience in working deployments.

This specific event indicates that a high threshold was exceeded.

event.descr:
A low threshold has been exceeded on %nodelabel%. The %service% data source expression %parm[ds]% on resource %parm[label]% has reached a value of %parm[value]% while the threshold is %parm[threshold]%, for %parm[trigger]% consecutive sample(s).


Description%parm[description]%
Data Source%parm[ds]%
Resource Label%parm[label]%
Resource Instance ID%parm[instance]%
Resource Instance Label%parm[instanceLabel]%
Resource ID%parm[resourceId]%
Current Metric Value%parm[value]%
Threshold Value%parm[threshold]%
Rearm Value%parm[rearm]%
Trigger Value%parm[trigger]%
event.logmsg: A low threshold has been exceeded on %nodelabel%. The %service% data source expression %parm[ds]% on resource %parm[label]% has reached a value of %parm[value]% while the threshold is %parm[threshold]%, for %parm[trigger]% consecutive sample(s).
event.operinstruct:
By default, OpenNMS watches some key parameters on devices in your network and will alert you with an event if certain conditions arise. For example, if the CPU utilization on your Cisco router maintains an inordinately high percentage of utilization for an extended period, an event will be generated. These thresholds are determined and configured based on vendor recommendations, tempered with real-world experience in working deployments.

This specific event indicates that a low threshold was exceeded.

event.descr:
A low threshold has been rearmed on %nodelabel%. The %service% data source expression %parm[ds]% on resource %parm[label]% has reached a value of %parm[value]% while the rearm is %parm[threshold]%, while the rearm value is %parm[rearm]%.


Description%parm[description]%
Data Source%parm[ds]%
Resource Label%parm[label]%
Resource Instance ID%parm[instance]%
Resource Instance Label%parm[instanceLabel]%
Resource ID%parm[resourceId]%
Current Metric Value%parm[value]%
Threshold Value%parm[threshold]%
Rearm Value%parm[rearm]%
Trigger Value%parm[trigger]%
event.logmsg: A low threshold has been rearmed on %nodelabel%. The %service% data source expression %parm[ds]% on resource %parm[label]% has reached a value of %parm[value]% while the rearm is %parm[threshold]%.
event.operinstruct:
By default, OpenNMS watches some key parameters on devices in your network and will alert you with an event if certain conditions arise. For example, if the CPU utilization on your Cisco router maintains an inordinately high percentage of utilization for an extended period, an event will be generated. These thresholds are determined and configured based on vendor recommendations, tempered with real-world experience in working deployments.

This specific event indicates that a low threshold was exceeded.

event.descr:
A relative change threshold has been exceeded on %nodelabel%. The %service% data source expression %parm[ds]% on resource %parm[label]% has changed from %parm[previousValue]% to %parm[value]%, while the multiplier is %parm[multiplier]%.


Description%parm[description]%
Data Source%parm[ds]%
Resource Label%parm[label]%
Resource Instance ID%parm[instance]%
Resource Instance Label%parm[instanceLabel]%
Resource ID%parm[resourceId]%
Current Metric Value%parm[value]%
Previous Value%parm[previousValue]%
Multiplier (Threshold Value)%parm[multiplier]%
event.logmsg: A relative change threshold has been exceeded on %nodelabel%. The %service% data source expression %parm[ds]% on resource %parm[label]% has changed from %parm[previousValue]% to %parm[value]%, while the multiplier is %parm[multiplier]%.
event.operinstruct:
This is used for detecting a change between two samples when the size of the change relative to one of the samples is important, as opposed to the absolute size of the change. For example, a 5% change in outbound traffic can be represented with a single threshold that will work on both a 1200bps dial-up link and a 10Gbps backbone link.

This only uses one configuration option, the 'value', which is set to the relative triggering upper bound (if less than 1.0) or relative triggering lower bound (if greater than 1.0) when to trigger the threshold. For example, a value of "0.95" will trigger if the sample goes down at least 5% from the previous sample (so it will trigger at -5%, -10%, etc., but not -4% or +5%). A value of "1.05" will trigger if the sample goes up at least 5% from the previous sample (it will trigger at +5%, +10%, etc., but not +4% or -5%). Every time the relative threshold is exceeded, a threshold event is triggered. Note that there is currently no support for triggering only after a certain number of individual exceeded thresholds or disabling further events from being sent until the threshold "rearms."

Finally, if you want to support a positive and negative threshold on a data source, for example greater than +/-5%, two thresholds will need to be configured, one for "0.95" to catch <= -5%, and "1.05" to catch >= +5%.

event.descr:
An absolute change threshold has been exceeded on %nodelabel%. The %service% data source expression %parm[ds]% on resource %parm[label]% has changed from %parm[previousValue]% to %parm[value]%, while the threshold is %parm[changeThreshold]%.


Description%parm[description]%
Data Source%parm[ds]%
Resource Label%parm[label]%
Resource Instance ID%parm[instance]%
Resource Instance Label%parm[instanceLabel]%
Resource ID%parm[resourceId]%
Current Metric Value%parm[value]%
Previous Value%parm[previousValue]%
Change Threshold%parm[changeThreshold]%
event.logmsg: An absolute change threshold has been exceeded on %nodelabel%. The %service% data source expression %parm[ds]% on resource %parm[label]% has changed from %parm[previousValue]% to %parm[value]%, while the threshold is %parm[changeThreshold]%.
event.operinstruct:
This is used for detecting a change between two samples when the absolute change between the samples is important. For example, on a fiber-optic link, a change in loss of anything greater than (say) 3 dB is a problem, no matter what the value was to start with, nor what the final value is. This is likely to be more useful on Gauge type data items than counters, but YMMV.

This only uses one configuration option, the 'value', which is set to the size of the change that will trigger the threshold. For example, a value of "3" will trigger if the sample goes up by at least 3 compared to the previous sample. A value of "-3" will trigger if the sample goes down by at least 3 compared to the previous sample. Every time the absolute threshold is exceeded, a threshold event is triggered. Note that there is currently no support for triggering only after a certain number of individual exceeded thresholds or disabling further events from being sent until the threshold "rearms." If you have such a scenario, please contact the developers with details of your situation.

Finally, if you want to support a positive and negative threshold on a data source, for example greater than +/-5, two thresholds will need to be configured.

event.descr:
A rearming absolute change threshold has been exceeded on %no delabel%. The %service% data source expression %parm[ds]% on resource %parm[label]% has changed from %parm[previousValue]% to %parm[value]%< /b>, while the threshold is %parm[threshold]%.

event.logmsg: A rearming absolute change threshold has been exceeded on %nodelabel%. The %service% data source expression %parm[ds]% on resource %parm[label]% has changed from %parm[previousValue]% to %parm[value]%, while the threshold is %parm[threshold]%.

event.descr:
A rearming absolute change threshold has been rearmed on %nodelabel%. The %service% data source expression %parm[ds]% on resource %parm[label]% has changed from %parm[previousValue]% to %parm[value]%, while the rearm value is %parm[rearm]%.


Description%parm[description]%

Resource Label%parm[label]%

Resource Instance Label%parm[instanceLabel]%

Current Metric Value%parm[value]%
Threshold Value%parm[threshold]%
Rearm Value%parm[rearm]%
Previous Value%parm[previousValue]%

event.logmsg: A rearming absolute change threshold has been rearmed on %nodelabel%. The %service% data source expression %parm[ds]% on resource %parm[label]% has changed from %parm[previousValue]% to %parm[value]%, while the rearm value is %parm[rearm]%.

event.descr: %service% thresholding on interface %interface% failed.
event.logmsg: %service% thresholding on interface %interface% failed.

event.descr: %service% thresholding on interface %interface% previously failed and has been restored.
event.logmsg: %service% thresholding on interface %interface% previously failed and has been restored.

event.descr: Alarm #%parm[alarmId]% was determined to require an escalation of its severity.
event.logmsg: Alarm #%parm[alarmId]% for node:%nodelabel% was escalated.

event.descr: The Asset info for node %nodeid% (%nodelabel%) has been changed via the webUI.
event.logmsg: The Asset info for node %nodeid% (%nodelabel%) has been changed via the webUI.

event.descr: Status information for service %service% has been updated.
event.logmsg: Status information for service %service% has been updated.

event.descr: The Demand Poll requested on %nodeid% (%nodelabel%)
event.logmsg: The Demand Poll requested on %nodeid% (%nodelabel%).

event.event-label: OpenNMS defined internal event: Remote Poller A remote poller detected a node lost service
event.descr: A %service% outage was identified on interface %interface% from remote poller %parm[locationMonitorId]% from location: %parm[location]% with reason code: %parm[eventReason]%.
event.logmsg: %service% outage identified on interface %interface% from the remote poller %parm[locationMonitorId]%.

event.event-label: OpenNMS defined internal event: Remote Poller A remote poller detected a node regained service
event.descr:
The %service% service on interface %interface% was previously down as viewed by remote poller %parm[locationMonitorId]% in location %parm[location]% and has been restored.

This event is generated when a service which had previously failed polling attempts is again responding to polls by OpenNMS.
event.logmsg: %service% outage identified on interface %interface% from the remote poller %parm[locationMonitorId]%.

event.event-label: OpenNMS defined internal event: Remote Poller A remote poller has registered
event.descr:
This event is sent by the remote poller server side API when a remote poller is created.

A remote poller has registered from location %parm[location]% and been given the id: %parm[locationMonitorId]%.
event.logmsg: A remote poller has registered from location %parm[location]%.

event.event-label: OpenNMS defined internal event: Remote Poller A remote poller has started polling
event.descr: This event is sent when a registered remote poller begins monitoring services defined in its configuration.
event.logmsg: The remote poller %parm[locationMonitorId]% has started polling from location %parm[location]%.

event.event-label: OpenNMS defined internal event: Remote Poller A remote poller has been paused
event.descr:
This event is sent when a registered remote poller is configured with a polling package containing no services to poll. (experimental)

The idea here is that a webui administrator can pause a remote poller and the remote poller's configuration is changed to an empty polling package.
event.logmsg: The remote poller %parm[locationMonitorId]% in location %parm[location]% has been paused.

event.event-label: OpenNMS defined internal event: Remote Poller A remote poller has been shutdown.
event.descr: This event is sent when a registered remote poller is shutdown by the remote system.
event.logmsg: The remote poller %parm[locationMonitorId]% has been shutdown.

event.event-label: OpenNMS defined internal event: Remote Poller A remote poller has disconnected
event.descr: This event is sent when a registered remote location fails to report status and check for configuration changes at the required interval.
event.logmsg: The remote poller %parm[locationMonitorId]% has disconnected.

event.event-label: OpenNMS defined internal event: Remote Poller A disconnected remote poller has reconnected
event.descr: This event is sent when a disconnected remote poller reconnects and reports status changes and checks for configuration changes.
event.logmsg: The disconnected remote poller %parm[locationMonitorId]% has reconnected.

event.event-label: OpenNMS defined internal event: Remote Poller A remote poller's configuration has been changed
event.descr: This event is sent when a remote poller's configuration has been changed and was detected by the monitor.
event.logmsg: The configuration has changed for the remote poller %parm[locationMonitorId]%.

event.event-label: OpenNMS defined internal event: Remote Poller A remote poller's connection IP address has changed
event.descr:
This event is sent when a remote poller's connection IP address has changed.

The connection IP address for remote poller %parm[locationMonitorId]% in location %parm[location]% has changed from %parm[oldConnectionHostAddress]% to %parm[newConnectionHostAddress]%.
event.logmsg: The connection IP address for remote poller %parm[locationMonitorId]% has changed.

event.event-label: OpenNMS defined internal event: Correlator A widespread outage has been detected
event.descr: This event is sent when a widespread outage is detected. Typically used in correlation rules that detected a threshold # of monitors have detected the same outage.
event.logmsg: A wide spread outage of the service: %service% has been correlated from multiple remote pollers.

event.event-label: OpenNMS defined internal event: Correlator A widespread outage has been resolved
event.descr: This event is sent when a widespread outage has been cleared. Typically used in correlation rules that have detected that a wide spread outage has been cleared.
event.logmsg: A wide spread outage of the service: %service% has been resolved.

event.event-label: OpenNMS defined internal event: Correlator A service has been detected to be in a flapping state
event.descr: This event is sent when a correlation rule has detected that a service (%service%) is flapping.
event.logmsg: The service: %service% has been correlated to indicate a flapping state.

event.event-label: OpenNMS-defined internal event: Admin scehduled outage configuration changed
event.descr: This event is sent by the WebUI or the user when scheduled outage configuration has changed and should be reloaded.
event.logmsg: The scheduled outage configuration has been changed and should be reloaded.

event.event-label: OpenNMS-defined internal event: Admin threshold configuration changed
event.descr: This event is sent by the WebUI or the user when threshold configuration has changed and should be reloaded.
event.logmsg: The thresholds configuration has been changed and should be reloaded.

event.event-label: OpenNMS-defined internal event: Admin event configuration changed
event.descr: This event is sent by the WebUI or the user when event configuration has changed and should be reloaded.
event.logmsg: The events configuration has been changed and should be reloaded.

event.event-label: OpenNMS-defined internal event: Admin discovery configuration changed
event.descr: This event is sent by the WebUI or the user when discovery configuration has changed and should be reloaded.
event.logmsg: The discovery configuration has been changed and should be reloaded.

event.event-label: OpenNMS defined internal event: Trouble Ticket A request has been made to create a trouble ticket
event.descr: This event is generated to invoke the asynchronous Trouble Ticket API in OpenNMS for creating a new trouble ticket.
event.logmsg: A request has been generated to create a trouble ticket.

event.event-label: OpenNMS defined internal event: Trouble Ticket A request has been made to update a trouble ticket
event.descr: This event is generated to invoke the asynchronous Trouble Ticket API in OpenNMS for updating an existing trouble ticket.
event.logmsg: A request has been generated to update a trouble ticket.

event.event-label: OpenNMS defined internal event: Trouble Ticket A request has been made to close a trouble ticket
event.descr: This event is generated to invoke the asynchronous Trouble Ticket API in OpenNMS for closing an existing trouble ticket.
event.logmsg: A request has been generated to close a trouble ticket.

event.event-label: OpenNMS defined internal event: Trouble Ticket A request has been made to cancel a trouble ticket
event.descr: This event is generated to invoke the asynchronous Trouble Ticket API in OpenNMS for canceling an existing trouble ticket.
event.logmsg: A request has been generated to cancel a trouble ticket.

event.event-label: OpenNMS defined internal event: Trouble Ticket A communication error occurred
event.descr: This event is generated when OpenNMS is unable to retrive, save or update a ticket via the Trouble Ticket API.
event.logmsg: A communication error occurred between OpenNMS and the Trouble Ticket system with reason: %parm[reason]%.

event.event-label: OpenNMS defined internal event: Queued A request has been made promote data from the RRD Queue
event.descr: This event is generated to invoke the promotion data of the Queueing RRD Strategy for the file(s): %parm[filesToPromote]%.
event.logmsg: A request has been generated to promote data from the queue.

event.event-label: OpenNMS defined internal event: Event Translator An event received from Hyperic has been translated
event.descr:
This is a translated Hyperic Alert to associate with OpenNMS entity..

Alert reason: %parm[action.shortReason]%

Alert reason: %parm[action.longReason]%

%parm[resource.name]%
event.logmsg: Hyperic Alert: %parm[action.longReason]%

event.event-label: OpenNMS-defined internal event: Admin Syslogd configuration changed
event.descr: This event is sent by the WebUI or the user when the Syslogd configuration has changed and should be reloaded.
event.logmsg: The Syslogd configuration has been changed and should be reloaded.

event.event-label: OpenNMS-defined internal event: Admin a user has successfully authentication to the WebUI
event.descr:
This event is sent by the WebUI when a user has successfully authenticated.

OpenNMS user %parm[user]% has logged in from %parm[ip]%.
event.logmsg: OpenNMS user %parm[user]% has logged in from %parm[ip]%.

event.event-label: OpenNMS-defined internal event: Admin an authentication failure has occurred in WebUI
event.descr: This event is sent by the WebUI when an authentication failure occurs. OpenNMS user '%parm[user]%' (may be blank) has failed to login from %parm[ip]%. The failure event is %parm[exceptionName]% with the message '%parm[exceptionMessage]%'.
event.logmsg: OpenNMS user '%parm[user]%' (may be blank) has failed to login from %parm[ip]%.

event.event-label: OpenNMS-defined internal event: Admin a user logged out of the web UI
event.descr: This event is sent by the WebUI when a user logs out of the WebUI. OpenNMS user '%parm[user]%' logged out of the WebUI.
event.logmsg: OpenNMS user '%parm[user]%' logged out of the WebUI.

event.event-label: OpenNMS-defined internal event: Admin a user's session was removed from the WebUI
event.descr:
This event is sent by the WebUI when a user's session is removed for any reason other than a user-initiated logout. This generally means that the session timed out due to inactivity

.

OpenNMS user '%parm[user]%' has been logged out of the WebUI, most likely due to a session timeout

.
event.logmsg: OpenNMS user '%parm[user]%' has been logged out of the WebUI

event.event-label: OpenNMS-defined internal event: Eventd Autonomous TL1 message
event.descr:
This is a TL1 autonomous message delivered for host: %host%.

Message: %parm[raw-message]%

Alarm Code: %parm[alarm-code]%

ATAG: %parm[atag]%

Verb: %parm[verb]%

Auto Block: %parm[autoblock]%
event.logmsg: TL1 message: %host%:%parm[verb]%:%parm[autoblock]%

event.event-label: OpenNMS-defined internal event: Provisiond Provisioning Adapter Failed message
event.descr:
A provisioning adapter failed for host: %host%.

Message: %parm[reason]%
event.logmsg: Provisiond: %host%:%parm[host]%:%parm[reason]%

event.event-label: OpenNMS-defined internal event: Ackd Acknowledgment request
event.descr:
A message received requesting an Acknowledgable be acknowledged.

Acknowledgement Request:%parm[refId]% of type:%parm[ackType]% was received with the action:%parm[ackAction]% was received for User: %parm[ackUser]%

Typically received from an external source or as a choice of an AckReader implementation.
event.logmsg: Acknowledgement Request:%parm[refId]% was received for User: %parm[ackUser]%.

event.event-label: OpenNMS-defined internal event: Ackd Acknowledgment message
event.descr:
A message from the acknowledgment service that an acknowledgment has been processed:

Acknowledgable:%parm[refId]% of type:%parm[ackType]% was processed with the action:%parm[ackAction]%

Typically the result of a request via an AckReader or a generated acknowledge request event.
event.logmsg: Acknowledgement:%parm[refId]% of type:%parm[ackType]% was processed.

event.descr:
A message from the Provisiond NodeScan lifecycle that a NodeScan has completed:

The Node with Id: %nodeid%; ForeignSource: %parm[foreignSource]%; ForeignId:%parm[foreignId]% has completed.

Typically the result of a request of an import request or a scheduled/user forced rescan.
event.logmsg: The Node with Id: %nodeid%; ForeignSource: %parm[foreignSource]%; ForeignId:%parm[foreignId]% has completed.

event.descr:
A message from the Provisiond NodeScan lifecycle that a NodeScan has Aborted:

The Node with Id: %nodeid%; ForeignSource: %parm[foreignSource]%; ForeignId:%parm[foreignId]% has aborted for the following reason: %parm[reason]%
event.logmsg: The Node with Id: %nodeid%; ForeignSource: %parm[foreignSource]%; ForeignId:%parm[foreignId]% has aborted.

event.descr: DISCARD-MATCHING-MESSAGES is used in the syslogd to generate events that have no matching events. This event is not persisted by default.
event.logmsg: DISCARD-MATCHING-MESSAGES.

event.descr:
A message from the Reportd reporting service that a report has failed to run:

The report with name %parm[reportName]% failed to run for the following reason: %parm[reason]%
event.logmsg: The report with name %parm[reportName]% failed to run.

event.descr:
A message from the Reportd delivery service that a report could not be delivered:

The report with name %parm[reportName]% could not be delivered for the following reason: %parm[reason]%
event.logmsg: The report with name %parm[reportName]% could not be delivered.

event.descr: The Linkd process has started its attempt to discover links for this node.
event.logmsg: Linkd %parm[runnable]% started.

event.descr: The Linkd process has finished its attempt to discover links for this node.
event.logmsg: Linkd %parm[runnable]% completed.

event.descr: The Linkd process suspended its attempt to discover links for this node.
event.logmsg: Linkd %parm[runnable]% suspended.

event.descr: The Linkd process has started its attempt to discover links.
event.logmsg: Linkd %parm[runnable]% started.

event.descr: The Linkd process has finished its attempt to discover links.
event.logmsg: Linkd %parm[runnable]% completed.

event.descr: The Linkd process suspended its attempt to discover links.
event.logmsg: Linkd %parm[runnable]% suspended.

event.event-label: OpenNMS-defined internal event: Discovery reload specified daemon configuration failed
event.descr:
The hardware discovery on node %nodelabel% (IP address %interface%) has failed.

Reason: %parm[reason]%.
event.logmsg: The hardware discovery on node %nodelabel% (IP address %interface%) has failed.

event.event-label: OpenNMS-defined internal event: Discovery hardware discovery successful
event.descr: The hardware discovery on node %nodelabel% (IP address %interface%) has been completed successfuly.
event.logmsg: The hardware discovery on node %nodelabel% (IP address %interface%) has been completed successfuly.
